unnormalised: Okay, here's the generated blog post based on your specifications.
normalised: My trip to Kerala had been on my mind for months, a much-needed break from the Mumbai madness. I envisioned lush green landscapes, backwaters, and of course, delicious South Indian cuisine. The planning, however, turned out to be a bit of a challenge, especially when it came to finalizing the stay. I knew I wanted to experience a houseboat stay, so naturally, Alleppey was high on my list.

I started my search online, and the sheer number of options was overwhelming. From budget-friendly guesthouses to luxurious resorts, Alleppey seemed to have it all. One particular houseboat, “The Serene Backwaters,” caught my eye. Their online listing showed the address as "Near Punnamada Finishing Point, Alleppey, Kerala - six eight eight zero one three". It looked idyllic, but I wanted to be sure.

normalised: I dug a little deeper, checking reviews and comparing prices. Another option, "Green Palm Villa" located at “House Number twelve, Ward seven, Beach Road, Alleppey, six eight eight zero zero one,” seemed promising too, a cozy villa right by the beach. What tipped the scales was their cancellation policy and the fact that they offered airport pickup. With a flight scheduled to arrive at ten thirty P-M, that airport pickup mattered to me a lot.

normalised: Finally, after hours of research, I decided to book Green Palm Villa. I double-checked the address on their confirmation email: "twelve, Ward seven, Beach R-d, Alappuzha, Kerala six eight eight zero zero one, India." All seemed good. I even prepone my flight for the next day, because I was so excited!

unnormalised: I dug a little deeper, checking reviews and comparing prices. normalised: The journey to the villa was smooth, despite the late hour. I found the address given on the booking was really easy to find, thanks to clear signboards. Green Palm Villa turned out to be even better than the photos! The owner, a kind gentleman named Mister Nair, greeted me with a warm smile and a cup of chai. The room was clean and comfortable, and the sound of the waves was incredibly soothing.

normalised: My Kerala trip turned out to be everything I had hoped for, and more. The villa's location was perfect, just a short walk from the beach. The local shops and restaurants were easily accessible, and I even managed to visit the Alleppey Lighthouse, located at "Alappuzha Lighthouse, near District Court, Alappuzha, Kerala six eight eight zero one one."

normalised: The key to a stress-free trip, I realized, is taking the time to research and confirm your accommodation details. Getting the correct address, understanding the location, and checking reviews can make all the difference. I'm already planning my next trip, and this time, I'll be even more meticulous with my booking details. Maybe Goa next time, or even a weekend getaway to a hill station in Maharashtra.
